title: 112_s1484
content: The Act titled "Hyde and Related Amendments Codification Act" prohibits taxpayer-funded abortions and provides conscience protections by amending Title 1 of the United States Code to include a new chapter on these issues. The "Hyde and Related Amendments Codification Act" includes provisions such as prohibiting funding for abortions, health benefits plans covering abortion, limitations on Federal facilities and employees, and treatment of abortions related to rape, incest, or preserving the life of the mother. It also addresses the application to the District of Columbia and prohibits government discrimination against certain health care. The "Hyde and Related Amendments Codification Act" prohibits funding for abortions and health benefits plans covering abortion. Federal funds cannot be used for abortions, and there is a prohibition on funding for health plans that cover abortion. The "Hyde and Related Amendments Codification Act" prohibits federal funding for abortions and health benefits plans that cover abortion. Federal facilities and employees are also restricted from providing abortion services. The Federal Government allows for abortion coverage in health benefits plans as long as it is paid for with non-federal funds and not using matching funds from federally subsidized programs. The chapter does not restrict non-Federal health benefits coverage providers from offering abortion coverage as long as it is paid for with non-Federal funds and not using matching funds from federally subsidized programs. The chapter allows non-Federal health benefits coverage providers to offer abortion coverage with non-Federal funds, excluding matching funds from federally subsidized programs. It does not affect other Federal laws limiting funds for abortion or health benefits coverage including abortion. Sec. 307 states that the chapter does not apply to treating complications from abortions. Sec. 308 exempts abortions related to rape, incest, or preserving the life of the mother from certain limitations. The limitations on abortions do not apply in cases of rape, incest, or when the mother's life is in danger. In this chapter, any reference to funds appropriated by Federal law includes amounts approved by Act of Congress for the District of Columbia. The term 'Federal Government' encompasses the government of the District of Columbia. Additionally, there is a provision prohibiting government discrimination against certain health care entities. Sec. 310 prohibits government discrimination against health care entities that do not provide, pay for, cover, or refer for abortions. This includes individual health care professionals, hospitals, and provider-sponsored entities. The term 'health care entity' includes individual physicians, hospitals, provider-sponsored organizations, health maintenance organizations, health insurance plans, and other health care facilities. The courts have jurisdiction to prevent violations of this section by issuing legal or equitable relief, such as injunctions and orders to prevent disbursement. The term 'health care entity' encompasses various healthcare providers. Courts can issue injunctions and orders to stop violations of this section. An action can be initiated by any health care entity with standing to complain about a violation. The Secretary of Health and Human Services designates the Director of the Office for Civil Rights to receive and investigate complaints of violations of this section, in coordination with the Attorney General. Complaints related to Federal agencies or programs administered by other agencies are referred to the appropriate office of that agency.
